security: This summary of significant information has not been coordinated outside the Office of Current Intelligence. It does not representa complete coverage of all current reports received, nor does time permit the complete evaluation of all current reports which are included.
summary: A Central Intelligence Agency daily summary from December 6, 1963, covering military developments, international relations, the Cuban internal situation, economic development, insurgency, foreign service, air flight connections, shipping support, Chinese Communist relations, Bloc economic and political relations, non-Bloc commercial and political relations, and Cuban support of external subversive activities.
summary_one_paragraph: The CIA's Daily Summary from December 6, 1963, provides a comprehensive overview of intelligence related to Cuba, including military exercises in chemical warfare defense, Moscow's response to OAS meetings, reports of apparitions in Oriente Province, and the Portuguese ambassador's assessment of reactions to President Kennedy's assassination. It also covers Cuban economic issues, such as Carlos Rafael Rodriguez's dissatisfaction with agricultural policies, steps to improve the fishing industry, counterrevolutionary activities, and foreign relations with countries like the USSR, China, and Morocco. Further, the summary includes details on Cuban support for subversive activities in other countries, notably Venezuela and the Dominican Republic, along with preparations to recognize a Venezuelan government-in-exile.
title: Daily Summary
